{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2987584,"name":"tanisha baliga","username":"tanishaloveshercat","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/df788c/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T22:09:00.974Z","cooked":"

Hey! We were looking for drive train ideas and didn’t see any discussions of this topic for this year’s game. We’re curious to see what drive train your team is thinking of using this year and if you don’t mind sharing, why as well.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":70,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T22:09:00.974Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":105,"reads":892,"readers_count":891,"score":718.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":399332,"topic_slug":"2022-drivetrain-discussion","display_username":"tanisha baliga","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2022-drivetrain-discussion/399332/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2987595,"name":"Bri","username":"BriFRC","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brifrc/{size}/131024_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T22:18:55.537Z","cooked":"

West Coast Best Coast (only in terms of drivetrain, East Coast is the superior coast in terms of actual Coasts)

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":70,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T22:18:55.537Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":877,"readers_count":876,"score":525.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":399332,"topic_slug":"2022-drivetrain-discussion","display_username":"Bri","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":24}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31589,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Dream Big"},"post_url":"/t/2022-drivetrain-discussion/399332/2","custom_user_title":"Dream Big","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":21},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":27,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987597,"name":"RedLeader342","username":"RedLeader342","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/redleader342/{size}/174347_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T22:20:49.991Z","cooked":"

personally this year i dont expect a lot of defense, much less effective defense given the open field. and since the target you’re shooting for is round, getting bumped a little during shooting wont be a huge deal either. we may be leaning 6in mecanum on a versa chassis, but we havent decided yet. this eliminates the need for a turret which is good for us since we have never done a turret before and are pretty well experienced with mecanum at this point.
only huge disadvantage i see at the moment is mecanum preforms best with a square chassis, but to do the traversing you may want a longer chassis because of the 16in extension limit.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":70,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T22:20:49.991Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":866,"readers_count":865,"score":238.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":399332,"topic_slug":"2022-drivetrain-discussion","display_username":"RedLeader342","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14252,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Its BURNIE. not Bernie. And certainly not Burn-E."},"post_url":"/t/2022-drivetrain-discussion/399332/3","custom_user_title":"Its BURNIE. not Bernie. And certainly not Burn-E.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987606,"name":"IowaBoyInMN","username":"IowaBoyInMN","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/76d3ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T22:32:54.712Z","cooked":"

So we came to the exact opposite conclusion. There is a ton of open space and defense is fairly easy to play - simply bumping someone can disrupt a shot enough to miss. There will be many fixed distance shooters that need to be in the same spot again and again to shoot. Disrupting their positioning or disrupting them getting to their position should be relatively easy defensively. I could see one robot each match dedicated to defense - particularly if there is a robot that doesn’t have a good shooter.

However, it can be harder to play defense given the many rules limiting what you can do, but it is still very possible. I don’t know. I guess I’m not convinced this will be a year with minimal defense played.

Back to the drivetrain discussion - the floor is flat, meaning that there is little need for 6" wheels or pneumatic wheels to avoid obstacles. I would be stunned if someone did tank treads (although always fun to see). A 6 wheel drive with 4" wheels seems very doable.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":70,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T22:32:54.712Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":830,"readers_count":829,"score":481.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399332,"topic_slug":"2022-drivetrain-discussion","display_username":"IowaBoyInMN","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14252,"username":"RedLeader342","name":"RedLeader342","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/redleader342/{size}/174347_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":18}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26906,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2022-drivetrain-discussion/399332/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":18}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":18,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987611,"name":"tanisha baliga","username":"tanishaloveshercat","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/df788c/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T22:36:47.068Z","cooked":"

We had the same thoughts about defense as well. Since there is so much room a robot could easily be pushed around and with the ineligibility rules it’s kinda risky to play defense in my opinion.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":70,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T22:36:47.068Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":773,"readers_count":772,"score":169.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399332,"topic_slug":"2022-drivetrain-discussion","display_username":"tanisha baliga","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":26906,"username":"IowaBoyInMN","name":"IowaBoyInMN","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/76d3ee/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2022-drivetrain-discussion/399332/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987613,"name":"RedLeader342","username":"RedLeader342","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/redleader342/{size}/174347_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T22:36:56.837Z","cooked":"

well my thinking with the 6in is that if you use 2in versa tube for your chassis, and mount your wheel in the middle, that leaves you with 1/8in clearance over the cable run which is a little close. we could drop the wheels down a bit on the tube but not too much.

also combining mecanum and vision, you should be able to shoot from just about anywhere, not just one spot. also also, the target is round and you can move around it.

I feel like if you have mecanum you also need a rotating turret with vision to really make it hum. Yes, you could do it otherwise, but if you go mecanum, I feel like ya gotta go all-in and get the cool shooter too.

why? the robot turns. it moves in every direction. the turret is an advantage on tank/wcd because it cant do that. turret becomes a disadvantage on mecanum because of extra moving parts and weight and such. more motors, sensors, things to break

A holonomic robot with a turret can pursue balls in one direction while shooting in another direction. This is potentially significant, depending on how good your controls team is.

thats a fair point actually.
however being our cad mentor, being new to cad and design, and our team never having done a turret before, that may be an offseason project. i dont know if we should invest too much time into that ourselves.

And certainly not Burn-E."},"post_url":"/t/2022-drivetrain-discussion/399332/10","custom_user_title":"Its BURNIE. not Bernie. And certainly not Burn-E.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987625,"name":"Jim Forbes","username":"MrForbes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrforbes/{size}/165505_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T22:54:53.196Z","cooked":"

We got a blue and red box with a drivetrain kit in it. And it appears to be designed this year (5th iteration) to have both channels facing away from each other, so it’ll be easy to get the nuts in at the ends of the frame, and to attach bumper brackets.

Since we have a very small team this year, using the kit chassis will be yet another blessing, in terms of making something that will work well, with very little effort.

But it will be fun to see all the new drivetrain ideas that other teams will come up with!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":70,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T22:54:53.196Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":669,"readers_count":668,"score":283.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":399332,"topic_slug":"2022-drivetrain-discussion","display_username":"Jim Forbes","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/2022-drivetrain-discussion/399332/11","custom_user_title":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987626,"name":"IowaBoyInMN","username":"IowaBoyInMN","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/76d3ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T22:55:06.828Z","cooked":"

Yah, I was just mentioning it as the “All In” robot - with both mecanum and rotating turret. I am not advocating for it – it’s just the cool thing that everyone likes doing.

All the points that you bring up are absolutely valid in terms of added complexity and weight. We are debating if a turning turret makes any sense at all.

Insanely good. That’s how good your programmers and control team have to be. Insanely good. And, we will see some. And I will love watching them!

And certainly not Burn-E.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987634,"name":"IowaBoyInMN","username":"IowaBoyInMN","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/76d3ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T23:01:54.576Z","cooked":"

So, that’s interesting. We will almost certainly go wcd. We have minimal experience with a rotating turret (we’ve done a beta version during the summer). Our drivers are pretty good at aiming using a wcd. So, I think part of the team is thinking they don’t need a rotating turret.

I think a rotating turret is something we might iterate to - meaning we have a fixed hood to start with. Then, maybe a hood where we can manually adjust the angle. Then a hood where we might be able to adjust the angle with a motor (we have minimal experience, but some, with that). Then the final iteration would be with a turning turret.

The weight is always an issue with our robots. So, if we don’t have the available pounds to spare, we will go with the fixed hood.

RedLeader342:

personally this year i dont expect a lot of defense, much less effective defense given the open field.

bolding done by me

2014 was the last truly open field game in my opinion, are you suggesting open field games do not lend themselves to defense? Because if so I would look at some top level 2014 gameplay and see if that changes your mind.

i guess more of what i meant was the effectiveness of the defense. given the advancements we have seen in vision targeting, as well as what you’re targeting. if your drive system can out maneuver defense, which it has more space to this season, the defense is much less effective.
not to mention that year the robots were fairly large and the balls were robot sized so when there were 2 on the field, there was basically 8 robots worth of space taken up out there. and there was sometimes more that 2 balls at once following auto

Anthony_Galea:

Because if so I would look at some top level 2014 gameplay and see if that changes your mind.

You need to get to that top level of gameplay first.

I suspect many teams will be struggling due to how the last 2 years have been. I absolutely agree that defense will be a thing (and sure, i bet it will be relatively close to 2014 levels at the very top end), but i think a drive team, given time to actually practice, will be able to get around the average defense bot.
